tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Next 25 Money Winners from 2014 Web.com Tour Finals
tourBios.curYearHigh: Making his fifth career start (second as a member) on the PGA TOUR, the 54-hole leader finished T2 at the Shriners Hospitals for Children Open, snapping a streak of four consecutive 54-hole leaders/co-leaders winning the Las Vegas event. Play was suspended due to darkness Friday, leaving him with the lead at 11-under through 15 holes. Returned Saturday with a par-bogey-par finish (his only bogey of the round) to sit in a four-way tie for the lead before taking a one-stroke lead heading into the final round. Closed with his fourth round in the 60s (69) to finish one shot behind champion Smylie Kaufman.
tourBios.carHigh:
Has played on the Hooters Tour, Gateway Tour, New England Tour, eGolf Tour and Golfslinger.com Tour.

2014: Played in 23 Web.com Tour events, making 12 cuts. Had two top-10s and six top-25s. Finished the Regular Season 35th on the money list...Missed his first four cuts in Latin American only to return to the States and play his way into a playoff with Kris Blanks at the Chitimacha Louisiana Open. Opened with a 71, which was followed by 65-66-68, rounds that included 15 birdies, a hole-in-one (No. 8, third round) and just three bogeys. His 270 total was 14 under. Lost on the third extra hole to a birdie by Blanks. It was his best career showing on Tour. He entered the money list at No. 14...In June, qualified for the U.S. Open, his first major. Shot 77-74 to miss the cut at Pinehurst...His other top-10, a T7, came in mid July at the Utah Championship where he posted four rounds in the 60s...Made the cut in all four Web.com Tour Finals' events, with his best performance a T25 at the season-ending Web.com Tour Championship.

2013: Made the cut in 13 of 24 starts during his rookie Web.com Tour season, with seven top-25 finishes and a pair of top-10s...Earned his first career top-10 with a T6 at the Brasil Classic. Made the cut in three of his first four starts before his solid showing in Sao Paulo. Was under par each round of the weather-delayed event...Shot four consecutive rounds in the 60s at the Midwest Clasic in July near Kansas City and finished T6...Did not make a cut in any of the four Finals' events at the end of the year.

2010: Missed the cut at the Travelers Championship. 2006: Was T49 at the PalmettoPride Classic where he was a Monday qualifier, his first career Web.com Tour start...Made his first PGA TOUR start, at the Buick Championship (missed cut).
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Was the 2003 and 2006 Southeastern Conference individual champion...Second-team All-American selection in 2006.
tourBios.personal: Remembers attending the PGA TOUR's Travelers Championship in Hartford as a child...Favorite websites are deadspin.com and foxnews.com...Not many people know that he is afraid of flying...Would like to switch places with the director of the CIA for a day.

tourBios.exmtStatus: 18th on the 2015 Web.com Tour priority list
tourBios.curYearHigh: Making his fifth career start (second as a member) on the PGA TOUR, the 54-hole leader finished T2 at the Shriners Hospitals for Children Open, snapping a streak of four consecutive 54-hole leaders/co-leaders winning the Las Vegas event. Play was suspended due to darkness Friday, leaving him with the lead at 11-under through 15 holes. Returned Saturday with a par-bogey-par finish (his only bogey of the round) to sit in a four-way tie for the lead before taking a one-stroke lead heading into the final round. Closed with his fourth round in the 60s (69) to finish one shot behind champion Smylie Kaufman.
tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Finished the Web.com Tour season having played all 25 tournaments. Recorded four top-10s, eight top-25s and 12 made cuts. Was 18th in the final priority-ranking order...Opened with top-25 finishes of T21 in Panama and T17 in Colombia...First top-10 performance came in June in Wichita at the Air Capital Classic. Opened with a 67-66 to keep pace with the leaders, two back after 36 holes. Reeled off five consecutive birdies near the end of Saturday's third round for a 67. Was T3, three back. Started the final round with birdies on two of the first three holes but fell back with a double bogey on the final hole, dropping him to T9. Reached 58th place on the money list, his highest mark since March...Would miss five cuts in a row entering the Regular Season finale in Portland, leaving him at No. 81 and outside the Finals cutline of 75th place. A 68-66 start at Pumpkin Ridge had him in contention and projected to finish in the top 75. A third-round 71 was cause for concern. A timely 67 Sunday allowed him (and runner-up Tim Herron) to bump Scott Parel and Drew Scott out of the top 75 and secure a place in the Finals, at No. 69...Opened the Web.com Tour Finals two weeks later with more solid play at the Hotel Fitness Championship. Recorded four sub-par rounds, resulting in an eight-place finish. The following week at the Small Business Connection Championship at River Run, opened with a 9-under 63 that included a back-nine 29, giving him a two-shot lead. A second-round 65 was good enough to maintain his lead by one. Rounds of 73-71 on the weekend dropped him to a fifth-place finish...Withdrew from the third Finals' event in Columbus, Ohio, the Nationwide Children's Hospital Championship...Closed the Finals with a T18 at the Web.com Tour Championship.

 2014: Played in 23 Web.com Tour events, making 12 cuts. Had two top-10s and six top-25s. Finished the Regular Season 35th on the money list...Missed his first four cuts in Latin American only to return to the States and play his way into a playoff with Kris Blanks at the Chitimacha Louisiana Open. Opened with a 71, which was followed by 65-66-68, rounds that included 15 birdies, a hole-in-one (No. 8, third round) and just three bogeys. His 270 total was 14 under. Lost on the third extra hole to a birdie by Blanks. It was his best career showing on Tour. He entered the money list at No. 14...In June, qualified for the U.S. Open, his first major. Shot 77-74 to miss the cut at Pinehurst...His other top-10, a T7, came in mid July at the Utah Championship where he posted four rounds in the 60s...Made the cut in all four Web.com Tour Finals' events, with his best performance a T25 at the season-ending Web.com Tour Championship.

2013: Made the cut in 13 of 24 starts during his rookie Web.com Tour season, with seven top-25 finishes and a pair of top-10s...Earned his first career top-10 with a T6 at the Brasil Classic. Made the cut in three of his first four starts before his solid showing in Sao Paulo. Was under par each round of the weather-delayed event...Shot four consecutive rounds in the 60s at the Midwest Clasic in July near Kansas City and finished T6...Did not make a cut in any of the four Finals' events at the end of the year.

2010: Missed the cut at the Travelers Championship. 2006: Was T49 at the PalmettoPride Classic where he was a Monday qualifier, his first career Web.com Tour start...Made his first PGA TOUR start, at the Buick Championship (missed cut).
Amateur: Was the 2003 and 2006 Southeastern Conference individual champion at the University of Florida...Second-team All-American selection in 2006.
tourBios.personal: Remembers attending the PGA TOUR's Travelers Championship in Hartford as a child...Biggest thrill in golf is getting PGA TOUR card...Favorite websites are deadspin.com and foxnews.com...Not many people know that he is afraid of flying...Would like to switch places with the director of the CIA for a day.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR in 2016 is T2nd at the Shriners Hospitals for Children Open.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T74th in Scoring Average (Actual) on the PGA TOUR.
